Ubuntu 10.10, using the system Python 2.6.6 (in a virtualenv, as per the previous instructions).  Does anyone have any ideas what I'm doing wrong? Thanks!

The prep instructions themselves, in case anyone didn't see them:

1 Setting up your environment
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1.1 Install git
================
  - On Ubuntu =sudo apt-get install git-core= should do it.

1.2 Install gcc and make
=========================
  - On Ubuntu, =sudo apt-get install build-essentials= should do it.

1.3 Install virtualenv
=======================
  - On ubuntu, =sudo apt-get install python-virtualenv= should do
    it.

1.4 Create a virtual environment for our work
==============================
================
  - =virtualenv /home/noufal/projects/environments/extensions=
  - Replace the =/home/noufal/projects/environments/extensions= with
    a convenient path.

1.5 Install some extra python packages we use to test the project
==================================================================
  - =. /home/noufal/projects/environments/extensions/bin/activate=
  - =easy_install py= to get py.test

1.6 Get the repository.
========================
  - Get the source code and all the other stuff that you need from
    github using
    =git clone git://github.com/nibrahim/C-extension-tutorial.git=
    or
    =git clone https://github.com/nibrahim/C-extension-tutorial.git=

1.7 Build libcsv
=================
  - Go to the =extras/libcsv-3.0.0= directory.
  - Run =make= and see if =libcsv.o= and =libcsv.so= are created.

1.8 Build the example libcsv program
=====================================
  - Copy the =libcsv.o= file created in the previous step into the
    =C= directory

1.9 Build the pycsv module
===========================
  - In the =pycsv= directory, build the pycsv module
    =python setup.py build=
  - It should be created in the =pycsv/build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.1=
    (or corresponding directory on MacOS).
  - Add the full path to the =pycsv/build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.1/=
    directory to your =PYTHONPATH= environment variable.

1.10 Run the tests
===================
  - Go to the =pycsv/pycsv= directory and run =py.test tests= to run
    the tests and see if all of them pass.
In the instructions I don't see a step for installing python-dev ( sudo apt-get install python-dev ). Maybe missing? Haven't actually executed the steps though so I might be totally off.
@pagles Thanks for the suggestion, but I already have the latest python-dev.
For the record, I'm in the tutorial now, and the reason for my problem might be that it requires Python3. Installing that is the assumed first step.
I think you lost some header file.  For example, python.h
